column4: hi, in ubuntu server 10.04, why can't i: sudo apt-get install mysql; stop mysql;
2) when I install dbus, I get the error about sending message, why?
but mostly, why can't I: sudo apt-get install mysql; stop mysql in an out of the box ubuntu 10.04 LTS server?
stop is no command. try service mysql stop or /etc/init.d/mysql stop
question 1) why isn't dbus installed on mysql server, 2) why isn't dbus a dependency of mysql (a little know / little used package?)
anyway, you can install dbus yourself anytime
service mysql restart (cannot connecto system bus), so are you asking, why does mysql need "service mysql restart"?
yes, but how have you installed it? because dbus will get installed with a standard installation from an official livecd
which live cd do you mean? I mean ubuntu-server from the ubuntu website. You don't mean desktop do you?
you have downloaded the ubuntu server livecd from the website and installed ubuntu server on your system using it?
please do a fresh install using the official installation cd
